admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Ozone Depleting
            Substances Phase-Out Project is to assist Poland in carrying
            out its Country Program for Ozone Depleting Substances (ODS)
            phase-outs required by the Montreal Protocol and its
            amendments. Specifically the project will assist Poland to:
            a) support the phase-out of the consumption of
            chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) through adoption of proven
            cost-effective CFC-free Technologies; b) support the
            establishment of a national network for
            recovery/reclamation/recycling of refrigerants; and c)
            improve the capacity of the new Ministry of Economy to
            manage and oversee the phase-out of ODS in Poland though
            institutional strengthening. The Project consists of three
            components: a) technology conversion investment component
            which targets priority, cost-effective ODS phase-out
            activities in the refrigeration, foam, and aerosol sector;
            b) a recovery, reclamation and recycling component; and c)
            an institutional strengthening and training components.
